title: Let's play the "What Will Be Removed from CertainlyT's Champion's Kit Game"
body:
For example:
-  Yasuo lost his flow gain on his W
- Darius has a time limit to his ult before going on CD
- Thresh's lantern doesn't do AoE shield (only shields himself and another) and only 1 wall does damage
- Zed only has 1 clone rather than 3 on his ult

So, what will we see removed from Kalista in the patches after her release because she will be 90% be for sure broken once people know how to play her?

(Let's not rush to conclusions of Kalista being weak, see: Zed and Yasuo)

While Kalista certainly(T, heh) doesn't seem weak (at all, by any stretch of the imagination), I don't think her kit is as overloaded as Yasuo (the guy gets double crit chance. Why). I'm inclined to agree with most people here though; her E or passive will probably take some sort of hit, maybe a range reduction on her passive, or some sort of limit on E (either a hard limit or some sort of damage fall off, sort of like how Azir's soldiers do less damage if more than one are attacking the same target). I get the feeling that nothing is going to be outright removed, but instead a large portion of her damage is going to be nerfed and she's going to be really dependent on her support, if she actually proves to be toxic OP

EDIT: [Surrender@20](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2014/11/114-pbe-update.html) just put out some more info on her as she is on PBE currently. I might have to retract some of my statements. Good lord this champion is stacked. Her passive dash actually *scales* with her boot rank. Not to mention she can't cancel her auto attacks (both a blessing and a curse, I guess, but probably more of a blessing, given that she can reposition herself so much better than any other ADC). Her Pierce has this mechanic where you can stack up Rend on one target and Q it for the kill, which then carries *all* the stacks onto the next enemy in Pierce's path. Her W passive has a cooldown and both attacks need to be within a certain time, *but does %max health damage*, quite a bit, it seems too (12% at lvl 1, not sure if it scales with ranks). Given her mobility and Q poke, I can't imagine it's hard to follow up on support harass. Her E does still stack indefinitely, and doesn't appear to disappear if you switch targets (as far as I can tell). At least the stacks disappear after a few seconds and extra stacks only deal 20% damage, so there is *sort of* a limit built into it, based on your attack speed, and each additional spear does reduced damage, her ult also doesn't appear to deal damage, and base damages (possibly ratios too, not sure, Q seems ~1.0AD, E seems ~0.7AD?) on her spells seem on the lower end, so I guess those are some things.

Champions like Yasuo get banned out a lot even though their win rates are pretty low, but they make flashy plays and delete champions when ahead. It's the psychological factor). I do feel like people are overstating her strengths, but I also feel like you're overstating her weaknesses.

I agree damages on Q and E actually seem fine (I personally feel like she's better compared to utility ADCs like Ashe, rather than hypercarries like Vayne). I've been reading and watching everything I can on her so far; that's why the only things I've picked out as potentially overtuned/overloaded are the early game damage on her W passive and the mobility scaling with boots.

I've seen a few PBE games of her, and it does seem like melee champions even without a dash (ie. Skarner, so long as they have a proper opening and don't just mindlessly rush her) can still get on her when she's kiting; whether that's a lack of familiarity with her mechanics or actually an intended part of the game, I'm not sure

As for the W damage, solo-q players might not utilize it as well, but I feel like a lvl 1 trade with a Sona (Sona's Q + powerchord empowered auto + spellthief's proc x 2 + Kalista's empowered auto + 12% max health from W passive) can chunk a person for half their health, which, at the highest levels of competitive play, can probably outright win a lane. Synergy with other supports is probably less drastic, but still fairly potent.
